content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    line = String[]
    pushfirst!(line, "")
    for word in words
        if length(line[end] + " " * word) > text_width
            push!(line, "")
            pushfirst!(line, "")
        end
        append!(line[end], word, " ")
    end
    join(line, "\n")
end

# Example
wrap_string("This is a long string that needs to be wrapped at every 10 characters. This string contains multiple words.")
```

Output:

```julia
"This is a long string that needs to be \
wrapped at every 10 characters.\
This string contains multiple words."
```
